title: Maryland Pay-to-Stay Fees

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For each fiscal year from FY2019 through FY2023:
1. The operating budget for the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
2. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were charged or assessed on inmates
3. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were charged or assessed on inmates
4. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were paid by inmates and collected by the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services 
5. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were paid by inmates and collected by the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
6. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were unpaid and turned into outstanding balance or debt.
7. The total amount of outstanding medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were unpaid and turned into outstanding balance or debt
8. The total number of incarcerated adults who were charged room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration
9. The total number of incarcerated adults who were charged medical fees, including medical co-pays
10. The total number of incarcerated adults who participated in work-release or occupational/employment programs
11. The hourly rate of the work-release or occupational/employment programs operating under the department’s jurisdiction
12. The total amount of income earned by incarcerated adults employed in work-release or occupational/employment programs
13. The amount and percentage of the income from work release or occupational/employment programs that was used to cover the costs of inmates’ incarceration or care
14. Any policies and procedures relating to the imposition, collection, and enforcement of fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration or care

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

title: Massachusetts Youth Pay-to-Stay Fees

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Massachusetts Youth Pay-to-Stay Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

For each fiscal year from FY2019 through FY2023: 
1. The operating budget for the Department of Youth Services.
2. The total amount of room & board, or fees associated with the cost of a youth’s incarceration, that were charged and assessed on incarcerated youths.
3. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays and other expenses associated with the cost of care for an incarcerated youth, that were charged and assessed on incarcerated youths.
4. The total amount of room & board, or fees associated with the cost of a youth’s incarceration, that were paid by incarcerated youths or their families and collected by the Department of Youth Services.
5. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays and other expenses associated with the cost of care for an incarcerated youth, that were paid by incarcerated youths or their families and collected by the Department of Youth Services.
6. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of a youth’s incarceration, that were unpaid and turned into outstanding balance or debt.
7. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays and other expenses associated with the cost of care for an incarcerated youth, that were unpaid and turned into outstanding balance or debt.
8. The total number of incarcerated youths who were charged room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of a youth’s incarceration.
9. The total number of incarcerated youths who were charged medical fees, including medical co-pays and other expenses associated with the cost of care for an incarcerated youth.
10. Any policies and procedures relating to the imposition, collection, and enforcement of fees associated with the cost of youths’ incarceration or care.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne Byun

title: Alberto Kenya Fujimori Inomoto (26 July 1938 – 11 September 2024)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Alberto Kenya Fujimori Inomoto (26 July 1938 – 11 September 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former Peruvian president Alberto Kenya Fujimori Inomoto (26 July 1938 – 11 September 2024). His name is spelled in his native language, Japanese, as follows: 藤森 謙也. His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/09/11/world/americas/alberto-fujimori-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Nakasone AI Safety

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Nakasone AI Safety
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications (including emails, texts, direct messages, and instant messages), calendar entries, meeting agendas, memoranda, and other records of former Director of National Security Agency Paul M. Nakasone referencing artificial intelligence and potential safety issues. 
In conducting the search, please be sure to use alternative spellings for "artificial intelligence" such as "A.I.", "AI", and "A I", but this should in no way limit the search to only those four keywords.  
An example of potential safety issues would be the possibility of causing harm to humans. This example should in no way limit the scope of responsiveness to only the harm to humans. 
The date range for the request is May 3, 2018 – February 3, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Merrick Wayne

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by CM Hollingsworth's office between the dates of March 15, 2024 - May 15, 2024:
- Sender
- Recipient (To, CC, BCC)
- Date and time sent

title: LPRS

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: LPRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Public Records Request for Closed Investigative and Incident Reports

Dear Public Records Officer,

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.), I am requesting the following records:

Investigative and incident reports related to a 2016 burglary case involving a man named Gary Baston, whose home in Rancho Cucamonga was burglarized. The case involved the use of license plate readers (LPRs) and security camera footage to help identify and apprehend the suspects. The vehicle was identified by a round bumper sticker, and the suspects were later caught, leading to the recovery of many of Mr. Baston’s stolen items.

All closed investigative reports from 2020 to the present that mention the use of LPRs in conjunction with bumper stickers. Specifically, I am requesting records that include the keywords "bumper sticker" and "LPR" or "License Plate Reader". I also encourage the department to consider any additional search terms that may yield responsive records based on these parameters.

Under Government Code Section 6253(b), a request is considered valid if it provides "a reasonably focused and effective description" of the records sought. I believe that the keywords I have suggested are sufficiently specific to allow the department to identify responsive records, as they pertain to the use of LPR technology in identifying vehicles by their bumper stickers.

Since these records pertain to closed investigations, they should be subject to disclosure under the California Public Records Act. The California Supreme Court has consistently upheld the presumption of disclosure for records related to closed cases, except under specific, limited exemptions, none of which apply here. Additionally, as the Sheriff’s Department has previously spoken publicly about the use of LPRs, the records are not protected under confidentiality for investigative techniques.

Please provide these records in electronic format if possible. If any portions of the records are exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide the non-exempt portions and specify the legal basis for any redactions or withholdings.

Thank you for your attention to this request. I look forward to your response within the legally mandated timeframe. If you need any further clarification, please do not hesitate to contact me

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Traffic Stop Request

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

all data, including statistical information, collected from any Massachusetts Uniform Citation (“MUC”) issued in the Commonwealth between January 1, 2021 and May 2024.

Some important fields may include:

City of Boston Employee ID (6 digit ID)
Employee first name
Employee last name
Employee middle name
Badge Number
Rank
District/Taskforce
Date of Stop
Time of Stop
Location of stop
Latitude/longitude
Race of driver
Gender of driver
Age of driver
If search occurred
If contraband was found,

I also request a waiver of all fees for this request, as disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest and will contribute to the public’s understanding of operations and activities of the government. This request is being made for research conducted by Spark! at Boston University and will not be used for commercial use.

I expect the request to be filled in an electronically-accessible format, including for screen readers, excel, or CSV. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. We understand that the data may be large in size, so feel free to send it over in year or half-year increments.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. If you believe any of this information to be exempt, I ask you to please cite the specific portion of the law on which you rely. I also ask you to please redact any information you believe to be exempt and disclose the rest. If you need to discuss this request, I can be reached at 617-358-8514.

Sincerely,
Boston University SPARK!

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Vijay Fisch

communications.subject: 2024-FSIS-00345-F Acknowledgment Email
communications.communication: Dear Alexa Gagosz, This email acknowledges receipt of your attached Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS). Your request was received by this office on September 11, 2024. The FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i), requires USDA to make a determination in response to a FOIA request within 20 business days from its date of receipt. The Federal agency time limit may be extended by 10 business days as stated in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If your request seeks numerous records that will necessitate a wide-ranging search including searches with components and possible consultations with components that have a substantial interest in the determination of this request, USDA will invoke a 10 business day extension for determination of your request. You have the option to narrow the scope of your request to limit the number of potentially responsive records. Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Pursuant to USDA FOIA Regulations, Title 7 CFR §1.6(a), the USDA processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Provisions of the FOIA allow USDA to recover part of the cost of complying with your request. For purposes of fee assessment, you were categorized as an "all other" requester, pursuant to 7 CFR Appendix A to Subpart A of Part 1, Section (2)(b)(5)(i). For your review and information, a copy of the USDA FOIA Fee Schedule is attached. In accordance with 7 CFR Appendix A to Subpart A of Part 1, Section 3(b), your fees shall be waived where the amount of the fee is $25.00 or less. If you requested a fee waiver, please note that it is currently under consideration. A search will be conducted for records responsive to your request. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. A FOIA specialist will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. Your request has been assigned FOIA Case No. . Please refer to this case number in any future correspondence. If you have any questions regarding the processing of this request, please reply directly to this message or contact 2024-FSIS-00345-F or FOIA specialist Luke Harman at Luke.Harman@usda.gov. For additional information regarding USDA FOIA regulations and process, please refer to the information available online at FSIS.FOIA@usda.gov . (http://www.fsis.usda.gov/foia) www.fsis.usda.gov/foia Sincerely, USDA FSIS FOIA Office

title: Financial and other records on Cadet Uniforms

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Financial and other records on Cadet Uniforms
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records showing the standard issue of all uniforms to individual Cadets at the Virginia Military Institute (e.g. Cotee, Blouse, white and or greay pants, class uniforms, etc.) for the past two academic years including the current academic year.
2. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the purchase of each uniform item for cadets (by item and total) over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
3. Records showing the current number of each uniform item issues to cadets and remaining in stock available for issue to Cadets over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
4. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of each type of uniform item for cadets over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
5. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of maintenance of uniform item for cadets over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
6. Records showing the number and type of different uniforms issued to the football and basketbal teams  for the past two academic years including the current academic year and, if any of these uniforms were not re-used by subsequent players their disposition (discarded, given to players, etc.)
7. Records showing the source of funds used to purchase uniforms issued to the football and basketbal teams  for the past two academic years including the current academic year.
8. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the purchase of each uniform items for the football and basketball teams (by item and total) over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
9. Records showing the current number of each uniform item issued to the football and basketball teams and remaining in stock available for issue over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
10. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of each type of uniform item for the football and basketball teams over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
11. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of maintenance of uniform item for the football and basketball teams over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

Briefcam user manuals, audit logs, and metadata

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Briefcam user manuals, audit logs, and metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) User manuals, handbooks, or comparable instructional documents provided to the department by Briefcam regarding Briefcam products and services.

2) User audit logs documenting each time a department account has accessed or taken action on the Briefcam platform from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. Briefcam audit logs are recorded in a database that can be exported or accessed via API so I ask that you provide it to me as a .csv, .xls, or other database filetype.

3) Metadata for each real-time and smart alert generated by the department's Briefcam system from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. Briefcam automatically notifies authorized users when connected cameras detect pre-defined events (e.g. a crowd gathering) or profiles (e.g. a vehicle of interest). Please note that I am not requesting the video footage or any personally identifying information associated with the alert, but rather the metadata. Metadata includes, but is not limited to: the type of alert, any rules set for the alert, the date and time of the alert, who received the alert, locations associated with the alert, and algorithmic confidence scores associated with the alert. This metadata is stored in a database so I ask that you provide it to me as a .csv, .xls, or other database filetype.

If you have any questions about this request, please do not hesitate to ask. If you would like to set up a time to discuss this request over the phone, please email me at tfeathers@gizmodo.com.

In the event that you determine certain records or portions of records are exempt from disclosure, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation of the records or portions of records being withheld and the statutory exemptions under which they are being withheld.

I am requesting these records as a journalist in order to write articles in the public interest about the operations of a government agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

title: James Earl Jones (January 17, 1931 – September 9, 2024)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: James Earl Jones (January 17, 1931 – September 9, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into "Darth Vader" and "Mufasa" actor James Earl Jones (January 17, 1931 – September 9, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/09/09/arts/james-earl-jones-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Boehm Family Files (National Security Agency)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to read all of your files regarding myself and my immediate family, going back three generations, and any interactions we had with the covert side of the federal government.  My mother is Maureen Boehm nee Simpson, born 9/21/1947, and my father is Herman Boehm, born 4/7/1944.  My mother's father was Maurice Simpson, an Army scientist and unexploded ordinance technician in WWII, and my father's father was Herman Boehm, destroyer watch in WWII, captain of the buoy tender The Dahlia in the Coast Guard and one of the men who extinguished the Hindenberg.  My mother's mother was Doris Simpson nee Gardner and my father's mother was Adelaide Boehm.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Boehm

title: Placer.ai Geospatial Data Surveilance

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Placer.ai Geospatial Data Surveilance
communications.communication:
The normalization of surveillance and the erosion of data privacy is on the rise in communities across Illinois. This surveillance capitalism is the commodification of personal data by the hands of elected officials and city governments. Often, these technologies are implemented without the fully informed consent of the public, who are being subject to 24/7 warrantless surveillance. Given this concerning trend, we are requesting documents that shed light on the City of Evanston’s involvement with Placer.ai.

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, we hereby request the following records:

	1.	Contracts and Agreements: Copies of any contracts, agreements, order forms, or memoranda of understanding (MOUs) between the City of Evanston and Placer.ai, including any associated service-level agreements, terms of use, or scopes of work.
	2.	Data Usage Reports: Any reports, summaries, presentations, or internal documentation that detail how the City of Evanston is utilizing data or analytics from Placer.ai, including any findings or conclusions drawn from the data.
	3.	Privacy Policies and Guidelines: Any policies, guidelines, or internal communications concerning data privacy and protection related to the City of Evanston’s use of Placer.ai. This should include how data from Placer.ai is collected, stored, used, or shared, as well as any privacy impact assessments conducted.
	4.	Funding Information: Records detailing the funding sources for the City of Evanston’s engagement with Placer.ai, including any external funding such as grants or private partnerships that contributed to the adoption of this service.
	5.	Public Notices and Engagement: Copies of any public notices, press releases, or communications that informed business owners and/or community members about the use of Placer.ai, as well as any documents outlining efforts to engage the public or seek community input on this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, we would be grateful if you would inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling our request. We would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or USB drive if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

title: Inspection Reports for Wild Island Water Park

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Inspection Reports for Wild Island Water Park
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a copy of all aquatic facility inspection reports made for the Wild Island water park located at 250 Wild Island Court, Sparks, NV, 89434 from January 1, 2022 to September 9, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Moore

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All restaurant inspections for Beaujolais Bistro located at 753 Riverside Dr, Reno, NV, 89503, from January 1, 2022 to present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katherine Fulwider
